Responsibility:
You develop new, in-depth data-driven insights and (predictive) models that help manage the cabin crew planning chain — ensuring that KLM remains one of the world’s leading players in crew scheduling. Our 9,500+ cabin crew members are not only deployed efficiently, but can also bring out the best in themselves on every single flight!

At KLM, you contribute to unforgettable journeys — no matter what your role is.

What will you do?
Everything falls into place with you at the helm as Data Scientist within the Planning & Assignment department of Inflight Services (P&A). You will operate at the intersection of crew scheduling, information technology, big data, and workforce planning. With your fresh perspective and expertise, you create new data-driven insights and (predictive) models that improve our scheduling and capacity management processes. You know exactly how to use models and techniques to extract meaningful information from large volumes of data — leading to better decisions. The enormous amount of data generated daily by our 9,500 crew members, KLM flights, and scheduling systems doesn’t intimidate you — you see it as an exciting challenge.

You’ll work as part of multidisciplinary teams with business experts, end users, and data and software engineers. Together, you’ll turn models into practical business products that are actually used within the organization.

In addition, you will:
Proactively engage with the business to understand their challenges and needs;
Regularly connect with other data scientists in the KLM data community to share knowledge and learn from one another;
Act as a data (science) advisor and consultant for your colleagues.

This role allows you to use your innovative ideas to optimize the strategic workforce planning of cabin crew and ensure that rosters align even better with employees’ preferences.
Target Job Industry/Sector: Airline / Aviation / Inflight Services / Workforce Planning
Behavioral requirement: You are an experienced, enthusiastic, and results-oriented data scientist. You’re entrepreneurial, unafraid to experiment, and known for your creative problem-solving skills. You have strong analytical capabilities — quickly getting to the heart of complex issues — and the communication skills to explain your work clearly, even to non-technical colleagues.
Company Values: According to research, women are less likely to apply than men when they don't meet all the job requirements. What a shame. Because, in our view, 'the perfect candidate' is a myth. So, if you have the drive to grow in aspects of this role, we look forward to your application.
